articles.headline: Harris’s Faith, Inside and Outside the Black Church
articles.snippet: Her biography embodies the multifaith, pluralistic and increasingly secular America she is bidding to lead.
articles.abstract: Her biography embodies the multifaith, pluralistic and increasingly secular America she is bidding to lead.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Rev. Dr. Amos Brown was taking his usual Sunday afternoon nap in late July when a longtime congregant, Vice President Kamala Harris, called.
articles.byline: By Ruth Graham and Clyde McGrady

articles.headline: In a Malaysian Pop-Up City, Echoes of China’s Housing Crash
articles.snippet: Forest City was an audacious $100 billion project by a top Chinese developer. Today, the project is a fraction of what had been planned and the developer is broke.
articles.abstract: Forest City was an audacious $100 billion project by a top Chinese developer. Today, the project is a fraction of what had been planned and the developer is broke.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was an audacious real estate project undertaken a decade ago by a Chinese developer: a $100 billion city in Malaysia built on sand and shrubby mangroves and sold as a luxury “dream paradise” for China’s middle class.

articles.headline: The Quest to Save the ‘King’ of Japanese Rice From Rising Temperatures
articles.snippet: Scientists in Japan are mining DNA to try to make the country’s famous Koshihikari rice resistant to heat, after a broiling summer ravaged the crop.
articles.abstract: Scientists in Japan are mining DNA to try to make the country’s famous Koshihikari rice resistant to heat, after a broiling summer ravaged the crop.
articles.lead_paragraph: Scientists in Japan are racing against time to save the country’s most popular rice from the devastating effects of climate change.
articles.byline: By River Akira Davis, Hisako Ueno and Noriko Hayashi

articles.headline: For Vance, an Idyllic Appalachian Startup Became a Hard Lesson
articles.snippet: During JD Vance’s brief career as a venture capitalist, few startups attracted his support more than AppHarvest, a now bankrupt plan to build greenhouses across Appalachia.
articles.abstract: During JD Vance’s brief career as a venture capitalist, few startups attracted his support more than AppHarvest, a now bankrupt plan to build greenhouses across Appalachia.
articles.lead_paragraph: For JD Vance, it seemed like the perfect investment.
articles.byline: By Danny Hakim and Austyn Gaffney

articles.headline: Harris’s Early Career: Prosecutor by Day, Boldface Name by Night
articles.snippet: As Kamala Harris toiled as a junior prosecutor in Alameda County, Calif., she developed important connections among San Francisco’s financial and social elite.
articles.abstract: As Kamala Harris toiled as a junior prosecutor in Alameda County, Calif., she developed important connections among San Francisco’s financial and social elite.
articles.lead_paragraph: In August 1996, a jury in an Oakland, Calif., courtroom convicted a man of slicing off a portion of his girlfriend’s scalp. The prosecutor was Kamala Harris, and the gruesome case was one of the few that made news early in her career.
articles.byline: By Tim Arango and Heather Knight

articles.headline: Hamas’s Guerrilla Tactics in North Gaza Make It Hard to Defeat
articles.snippet: Israel has decimated Hamas’s military wing, along with much of Gaza. But the group’s small-scale, hit-and-run approach poses a threat in the enclave’s north.
articles.abstract: Israel has decimated Hamas’s military wing, along with much of Gaza. But the group’s small-scale, hit-and-run approach poses a threat in the enclave’s north.
articles.lead_paragraph: The top commanders of Hamas are mostly dead. The group’s rank and file has been decimated. Many of its hide-outs and stockpiles have been captured and destroyed.
articles.byline: By Patrick Kingsley and Aaron Boxerman

articles.headline: The Princess and the Justice
articles.snippet: Princess Gloria von Thurn und Taxis bonded with Justice Samuel A. Alito Jr. over Catholicism and ending abortion. She introduced him to her sumptuous world when he visited her Bavarian palace.
articles.abstract: Princess Gloria von Thurn und Taxis bonded with Justice Samuel A. Alito Jr. over Catholicism and ending abortion. She introduced him to her sumptuous world when he visited her Bavarian palace.
articles.lead_paragraph: The princess was late for Mass.
articles.byline: By Abbie VanSickle, Philip Kaleta and Ingmar Nolting

articles.headline: I.M.F. Says Inflation Fight Is Largely Over but Warns of New Threats
articles.snippet: The International Monetary Fund said protectionism and new trade wars could weigh on growth.
articles.abstract: The International Monetary Fund said protectionism and new trade wars could weigh on growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: The global economy has managed to avoid falling into a recession even though the world’s central banks have raised interest rates to their highest levels in years to try to tame rapid inflation, the International Monetary Fund said on Tuesday.

articles.headline: ‘No Smoking’ Signs on Planes Can Now Stay On Forever
articles.snippet: The Federal Aviation Administration did away with a rule that had required an off switch for the sign even though smoking on U.S. flights ended years ago.
articles.abstract: The Federal Aviation Administration did away with a rule that had required an off switch for the sign even though smoking on U.S. flights ended years ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: The days of airplane cabins hazy with cigarette smoke are long gone, but a reminder of that era is still visible inside commercial jets.

articles.headline: Trump Media’s Soaring Share Price Masks Internal Strife
articles.snippet: Employees have complained to the board about hiring and management practices at the parent company of Truth Social, which serves as the main online megaphone for former President Donald Trump.
articles.abstract: Employees have complained to the board about hiring and management practices at the parent company of Truth Social, which serves as the main online megaphone for former President Donald Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: The parent company of former President Donald J. Trump’s social media platform has soared on the stock market over the past month, despite growing turmoil behind the scenes.

articles.headline: Jamie Dimon Privately Supports Kamala Harris. He Just Won’t Say So.
articles.snippet: JPMorgan’s chief executive has told associates of his support for the vice president, and his dislike of Donald Trump. But fearful of blowback, he won’t say it publicly.
articles.abstract: JPMorgan’s chief executive has told associates of his support for the vice president, and his dislike of Donald Trump. But fearful of blowback, he won’t say it publicly.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Jamie Dimon surprised the political and financial elite early this year by praising some of Donald J. Trump’s policies, the longtime Democrat set off speculation that he had switched his allegiance to the Republican candidate.

articles.headline: Former Abercrombie C.E.O. Is Charged With Running Sex-Trafficking Ring
articles.snippet: Prosecutors said Michael Jeffries and two others coerced dozens of men into sex acts during Mr. Jeffries’s tenure at the clothing company.
articles.abstract: Prosecutors said Michael Jeffries and two others coerced dozens of men into sex acts during Mr. Jeffries’s tenure at the clothing company.
articles.lead_paragraph: Michael S. Jeffries, the former longtime chief executive of Abercrombie & Fitch, was indicted on Tuesday on charges of running an international sex-trafficking scheme during several years of his tenure at the company.
